DOC.detailed_description: Studies demonstrate non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) rectal suppository associate less pain 24 hour birth , less additional analgesia require . Therefore , In view rectal route analgesic administration well local action systemic paracetamol also proven effective control post-partum perineal pain unknown effectiveness suppository form ; investigator would like conduct study investigate effectiveness acetaminophen rectal suppository versus diclofenac rectal suppository control postpartum perineal pain . This study conduct 2 stage . Stage 1 3 month prospective observational study aim determine prevalence severity perineal pain follow childbirth Hospital Sultanah Aminah , Johor Bahru ; Stage 2 single blind , open-labelled , randomize control trial study design determine acetaminophen rectal suppository equivalence diclofenac rectal suppository reduce postpartum perineal pain secondary perineal trauma .
